intro: Mesembryanthemum latum, commonly known as the broadleaf ice plant, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, often hairy leaves and showy, daisy-like flowers. The plant is adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick, fleshy stems and leaves. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Mesembryanthemum latum is often used in rock gardens and xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental appeal.
